comment: Honestly, I do not know how he has negative reviews. Yes, He is very specific on how he want his Labs, but honestly not hard instructions to follow. Just show up to Lab, and do the work. He is very knowledgeable in the instrumentation, and will work with you as long as you try. There is a Pre-Lab due right before each Lab. He also replies quick.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Couldn't show up to a lab, decided to do the lab on my own time. Says that since he didn't see me doing the lab, I will be receiving no credit for it, even if all the work is correct and the lab was relatively easy to do. Very rude over email, gladly only taking him for lab
Labs were very helpful to learn. He knows his stuffs. His labs helped me to lift my course grade to A.

Don't believe the negative reviews. If you look closely you can tell it's all just the same guy review bombing. This professor is great just DO THE HOMEWORK and it's an easy A. He even highlights the important equations so you're never caught off guard on test. Easily one of my favorite profs. Had him for 2 classes and couldn't let this slander go.
Just listen the lectures and do the homeworks. It wasn't a difficult A for me.

I've had some uptight professors before, especially at KSU, but nothing compares to Das. Thankfully only have him for lab, but I can tell he's going to be an absolute pain. Leave equipment out for next lab? -5 points. Breath incorrectly? -5 points. Never heard of a professor who penalizes students for resubmitting assignments before the due date.
terrible professor, not fit to teach

I believe this man gets genuine joy out of seeing students suffer. This is my second time taking a course with him and this semester he has completely gone off the rails. I believe he is currently trying to fail me and delay my graduation. Reporting him to the chair, dean and whomever else it may concern. This man MUST be removed from his position!

He's the worse, take him at your own risk. I'm sure some of the good reviews on here are older, from a time when he was sane, before ChatGPT, now he's gone insane, totally. He needs to see a doctor about this weird obsession with catching people cheating, its not normal. Also has like a million rules that you have to follow or he'll fail you.

Do not believe these "perfect scores" on here. They're all lies and someone can take a very accurate guess as to where they came from. Stringent rules that must follow for every assignment unless you'll lose points, has an unhealthy obsession with catching cheaters, and heavy lectures videos that can be difficult to understand at times. STAY CLEAR!

I don't think an elective has stressed me out as much as this one has with Das. Genuinely the worst professor i've taken at KSU. I don't know how he's still allowed to be a professor here honestly.  It genuinely felt like a boot camp the entire semester and he has some weird fetish with finding cheaters when no one cares that much about his class.

Low esteem professor that seems paranoid every student is out there cheating or using AI in his class. 
Miserable to listen to for hours in the lecture videos.
Very draconian rules for all class work and exams.
Either grades immediately or leaves you waiting for weeks. 
Unpleasant learning experience. Take with anyone else if you can!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment:
The only pro is that this course is super structured. This is an Elective Course that somehow has caused me more stress and dread than my hardest EE courses. Not only should you never take this professor. Under no circumstances is this man fit to teach and raise the next generation of engineers...

Genuine stain on KSU's reputation

Unsure what sort of upbringing forces a person to be this cruel. He has no regard for you as a human being. He sees you as a machine that should have 100% uptime. This course should have been simple, enlightening and fun and yet it has completely ruined my week over ridiculous requirements. I mean this WHOLE HEARTEDLY this man should NOT be a prof!

Homework is 50% of your grade... He is also terrible at giving credit where needed. How does 1 person in your entire class get a 100 on homework but no one else? His lecture notes are horrendous to look at. He's also super rude in emails. Final exam is over 10-20 pages of work that has to be labeled step by step in order to get credit. Stay Away

Sucks to work with. 
Need to reschedule your final due to a scheduling conflict? Not his problem, yours, go work it out with the other party cause he's not changing his schedule for "your mistake."

Only 3 homework assignments and 3 exams the entire semester for your grade. 

Do you like tedious unit conversion formulas written out? He loves them.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Hands down the worst professor i've taken in my 4 years at KSU. You'll spend most of your time scrambling to meet deadlines instead of actually learning anything. He has every thing tailored to his needs and doesn't take the students day to day life into consideration. Crazy part is I think he thinks what he's doing is fun for students or something

Bro really wants you to suffer, Homework can easily take 10-20 hours MINIMUM. Grades pretty rough and wants specific formats for you work when you do exams. 2 attempts on test, still requires work submission. Final is Lockdown and must show 10-20 pages of work.. And it has to be numbered step by step otherwise 0 credit. Dont take unless you NEED to

Honestly in shock by how genuinely awful this guy is. Its like he is a robot masquerading as a human. Has 0 emotion only assigns busy work. Barely learn anything and if you breathe wrong you'll lose 5 points. This is my last semester and thanks to this guy it's twice as hard as it should be. I would steer clear of this nut case if I were you.

This professor is so bad that I am writing another review. Do not take this professor especially during the summer. He treats this elective class like it's one of your major courses. If you don't do things his way you will lose points. Extremely picky professor.

Genuinely do not understand why this guy is so picky. The home works are a 10 page documents that takes 15-20 hours to complete. His rules are so absurd as well only certain fonts and page scanners are allowed god forbid you disobey his paramount commands he will smite 5-25% off for every infraction

I have never taken a professor more picky than Das. It's so bad that i'm giving him a review after 2 weeks of class. His HWs are insanely long and he wants you to do them his way only. You shouldn't have to do this much work for an elective class. If you're EE looking for decent electives, only take his class as a last resort. You have been warned.
A very good elective class for EE majors. This was my last semester. Taking this class was the best decision I made before graduating out.
Thoroughly enjoyed this class. Tests were straightforward. Best part was the group project, it gave me the space to learn a lot.
Dr. Das is an intelligent professor but has stringent demands on how assignments are done in his class. His exams are notably lengthy and can be challenging to complete within the time provided

Very structured class. Dr. Das's lectures were focused with lots of detailed explanations. Exams gave multiple attempts, which really helped me to get a good grade and learn from my small mistakes. Overall the materials in this class were very interesting.

Decent professor but he is SUPER lecture heavy. The tests that he gives are horrible! They are nothing compared to the homework you do. If you have better to do in your life and have all the time in the world, go break a leg with professor das, but if not, dont take him

Prof. Das is one of the best professors I have taken at KSU. He is super knowledgeable and I could not ask him any question that he could not answer. I learned way more than other classes and felt like an engineer after taking this class! He gave many extra credits and grades with partial credits which is really helpful.

This professor wasn't able to explain the lectures in a way that I could understand. His accent was difficult to understand with the mask on. He went through lessons quickly and didn't help with homework. The examples he gave were nothing like homework. I just felt like he was not a good professor for me.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Das is probably one of the worst professors I've taken at Kennesaw. His goal every semester is to catch someone cheating(cheating to him is working together on hw assignments or finding formulas that aren't his and using them). I would not recommend taking him unless you want a professor who is not great at teaching and will hunt you.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I've taken professor Das for both Semiconductors and Renewable Energy, and thoroughly enjoyed both classes. His PowerPoint lectures do well at explaining the material, even if you aren't able to make it to lecture. The tests in both classes were lengthy, but doable if you did some studying beforehand. Only downside was a group project in renewable.

Dr. Das clearly loves the research he does and enjoys sharing it, however, he expects a lot of his students. If you aren't prepared to put in as much hard work and enthusiasm as he expects you're going to struggle. Great professor, inspirational engineer and researcher, but if you don't love engineering as much as he does it'll be rough.

Dr. Das is one of my favorite professors. The lectures he has are very informative and he gives you the notes so you can pay attention and not get distracted jotting everything down. I loved his projects whiched helped reinforce my understanding.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: One of the best lecturers I've had a chance to listen to, he knows his material very well. He assigns lecture videos with a non-existent timeline to view the videos. On top of that, he holds in-person class just to discuss the videos and then wants a report on the lecture videos. His test are lengthy with not enough time to complete them.

Took Dr. Das for 2401. Very informative and interesting class. Knows his stuff very well. Tests are challenging but doable. and he is a Fair grader, so no complains there. will take him again for the solar class.

Das is one of the best Professors ive ever had. He truly is passionate and knowledgeable about material. I can get emails back within 10 minutes. Other than his grading scale (25% midterm 25% Final), he gives partial credit and familiar problems on test. Make sure to study and this class will be a great one.

This man is GEM within the EE department. He will give you the best, structured lectures you have ever seen (especially Semiconductors!). Although some say he is difficult, I GUARANTEE you will benefit from taking his class(es). He IS the best professor (in terms of teaching, explaining, and lecturing) in the EE department!

One of the most knowledgeable EE professor I met at KSU. Cool topics and lots of practical examples. I liked superconductors the most. Exams are challenging, but he is a fair grader and gives extra credits. Look forward to take him again for the Solar class.

Hes very very good at teaching the material. He is more difficult than others so Ive heard. Honestly though he did not seem that hard to me; I think what puts students off is the class requires more work than usual.

Dr. Das is one of the smartest professors Ive had a KSU. He is a challenging professor and expects a lot out of his students, but he is helpful if you approach him. I wish I would have gone to office hours. If you pay attention in class and study, you will be fine. Quizzes are online and tough, but he gives a lot of partial credit on tests
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: thank u, next
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: definitely one of the best lecturers I've experienced- he goes into detail, uses diagrams, shows how to set up problems, and really explains in detail important concepts. However, the course is pretty difficult, you need to deeply understand the variables/concepts to answer the harder questions. Lots of things to be graded, and partial credit.

Password protects the documents which make it very inconvenient to print the documents. KSU Print doesn't accept password protected docs. It is a hard class in itself. The quizzes and exams are hard. Gives partial credit so that a plus.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I will admit, i never met a professor so knowlegable about a subject before. He is hands down, the hardest professor I've ever had. With that being said, it made me understand the material so much more. He does give a lot of work at once, and its so tedious and stressful, but again, it made me learn. But I honestly, probably wouldnt take him again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He gives lot of partial credit on homework and midterm. All the assignments are based of lectures slides in class which he posts so no textbook is needed. There are lots of people who say he is hard but they usually complain and don't do the work. It isn't an easy class but you do learn if you want an easy grade and not learn just take Sheila
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: Don't pay tooo much attention to student's who tell you Dr. Das is a terrible professor. It is true that he is more difficult than the average professor, but he really is not all bad. PowerPoints/Lectures are the best I have seen; very knowledgeable in this subject. Can come off as rude sometimes, but use his office hours. He will help you no doubt

He is an amazing professor when it comes to teaching you the information. The homework given you can do based on what he teaches in class. The tests require a firm grasp on everything you learned in circuits 1 because the test will combine the 2 courses. Knowing the formulas is not enough. Do not take this Professor unless you are a A/B student.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Das is one of the best professors I have ever taken. He is very clear and concise in his lectures and tells you exactly what will be on the test. Not to say this class isnt difficult because it is one of the hardest classes i have ever taken. but if you listen to him in lecture and study your ass off you will do well.

Good instructor. Getting a good grade is hard but not impossible. Will have a question or two on exams that he didn't do in class but nothing too crazy. Gives a slight curve at end of the year in case you're on a bubble.

I had Prof. Das during summer 2016 for EE2401 and he was a great professor.  He covered the material thoroughly so it was understood and his tests were not very difficult at all if you studied the material.  He, in my opinion is truly one of the best prof's for EE at the school and doesn't deserve a poor rating.  Take him, learn and pass!

Dr. Das is a good instructor.  His teaching style is well structured and he knows what he's doing.  He didn't have us use a book and uses slides and the whiteboard to teach.  The class was fairly easy and his tests aren't surprising.  For EE 2401 he made his own hw q's which I liked because book problems dont always reflect whats in class.  irecmnd
